# 9.4 Compile OS

1. If the connections stated in step 3 are not selected click on the "Connection" button and select them in the open dialog box.
2. Note
- The symbolic connections (Named Connection) offer the following advantages:
- A descriptive name instead of a connection ID reduces the risk of error when associating the connections.
- The symbolic name remains unchanged, even if the IP addresses are changed again.
- Symbolic connections are created as reserved connections in the AS.

You can find additional information on symbolic connections (named connection) in the "SIMATIC Process Control System PCS 7 Operator Station" (https://support.industry.siemens.com/cs/ww/en/view/109746516) manual.
3.
Q: What are the advantages of using symbolic connections (Named Connection) in WinCC as described in the 'Compendium Part A - Configuration Guidelines (V9.0)'?
A1: Symbolic connections offer a descriptive name instead of a connection ID, reducing the risk of error when associating the connections.
A2: The symbolic name remains unchanged even if the IP addresses are changed, providing consistency.
A3: Symbolic connections are created as reserved connections in the AS, ensuring their availability.
A4: Using symbolic connections minimizes errors and maintains consistency by descriptive naming and unchanged names despite IP changes.
A5: Advantages include error reduction through descriptive names, consistency despite IP changes, and reservation in the AS.

A1: It ensures consistency and reduces the need for reconfiguration when IP addresses change.
A2: The unchanged symbolic name means less manual updating and fewer errors in connection settings.
A3: Maintaining the same symbolic name despite IP changes simplifies network management.
A4: This feature avoids the hassle of updating connection details every time the IP address changes.
A5: It provides a stable reference point that doesn't vary with network configuration changes.
